Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh: Speech Recognition Manager /

This Apple manual was written, edited, and composed on a desktop publishing system using Apple Macintosh computers and FrameMaker software. Proof pages were created on an Apple LaserWriter NTX printer. Final page negatives were output directly from text files on an Agfa Large-Format Imagesetter. Line art was created using Adobe\xC5 Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop. PostScript\xC5, the page-description language for the LaserWriter, was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated.

Text type is Palatino\xC6 and display type is Helvetica\xC6. Bullets are ITC Zapf Dingbats®. Some elements, such as program listings, are set in Adobe Letter Gothic.
